formattedAddress: 229 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 229 Front St, New York, NY 10038-2037, USA

originalText.text: Really good Mexican food. I loved the complex flavors of the guacamole with copious amounts of crab, and the crispy and umami tacos al pastor. I thought the fish was cooked really well, but I didn't love the sauce. The service was great, very attentive and communicative. The space is visually interesting, but too loud for me.

text.text: Really good Mexican food. I loved the complex flavors of the guacamole with copious amounts of crab, and the crispy and umami tacos al pastor. I thought the fish was cooked really well, but I didn't love the sauce. The service was great, very attentive and communicative. The space is visually interesting, but too loud for me.

originalText.text: The environment is pretty cool - perfect for a date night. I had the Inca Maia cocktail and it was so delicious! For food, we had a guacamole (perfect!) and also the Governador Taco - this was our favorite, we never thought that steak and shrimp would match so well. We had the Aguachile as well - if you like spicy food, you're gonna love it! Finally, we had the corn and another plate  called Cochinita Pibil. For dessert, of course, churros! Such an elegant place with delicious options! The food was full of flavors and the staff was so nice!

Such an elegant place with delicious options! The food was full of flavors and the staff was so nice!

originalText.text: the seafood is very good, very fresh, also quite expensive. the staff were attentive although our waitress wasn't very good at helping us when we had questions about the bottles of wines. all she said after asking the bartender, who also gave not tried it, is that one is drier than the other but she doesn't remember which is which. luckily, another staff who was slightly more knowledgeable and actually had an open bottle that he offered us a tasting before we made up our minds which was very nice and helpful. love the qr codes but the menu font is no good because it's too narrow making it harder to distinguish in low lighting for many people.

originalText.text:
I love a HAPPY HOUR and Seaport House has one of the best for anyone who likes to keep it simple and chill. My sister and I opted for appetizers and drinks.. From 5pm-7pm you can go crazy on the $1.50 oysters sold by the dozen or the half dozen. Their Buffalo Cauliflower is some of the best I have ever tasted, spicy with just a bite but not an overwhelming kick. The texture was just right as well, not too hard, not too soft. I also tried the Ceasar Salad $8 HH menu that came with anchovies and a side of Sautéed spinach  with garlic $5 side order.  Margaritas were a little pricy, but definitely worth it! Everything was DELICIOUS. My personal favorite was the cauliflower.

AMBIANCE: We sat in the outdoor space which was VERY posh and comfortable.

SERVICE: Even outside, the service was excellent and the waitstaff were very attentive without being annoying.

RESTROOMS: 2 clean unisex bathrooms. Who can ask for more?

1 star off because we had to ask about the Happy Hour menu. Also, we were charged for sparkling water that we ordered but never received because they didn't have any at the moment. When we pointed this out on the menu it was quickly rectified, so no harm no foul.

originalText.text: My friends and I planned to go to dinner at a neighboring place but they were closed for a private event. So we decided to meet here instead. Best. Idea. Ever. I'm picky about Mexican food. I've lived in Mexico. This is some of the best Mexican I've had in the city, hands down. We shared guacamole to start and it was super fresh. I opted for the enchiladas for my main. The sauce was delicious and the chicken tender. My friends had various tacos, rice, and elote. All very well flavored. We shared the churros with Mexican chocolate for dessert. The service was lovely. We met the manager Louis as he made an effort to come over and say hello and welcome us. Apparently they're not even a month old. But I'm certain they'll last for years to come. Buen provecho!
